messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Two men have just crossed my fence. They're trying to get into my house.
What is the address?
4202 Marlow Circle.
Can you repeat that address for me?
4202 Marlow Circle.
Is this a house or an apartment?
House.
What's the phone number you're calling from?
Your last name, please.
Orange. They're trying to break the window.
And your first name?
They're coming into my house. Maggie.
Okay Maggie, I understand. And it's two males, you said?
Yes. One in a red jumpsuit, the other in a blue and white hoodie.
And the one in the red jumpsuit, is he white, black, or Hispanic?
They just broke the glass.
Okay. The one in the red jumpsuit, is he white, black, or Hispanic?
Black or Hispanic.
And the second one, is he white, black, or Hispanic?
Black.
Okay, and what color clothing did you say he had on?
Blue and white hoodie.
Alright, we have officers en route to your location. Are they inside the house now?
Yes. They're in the house.
Are there any weapons involved or mentioned?
I can't see any.
And do you have any further descriptions on them?
No, not really. They just walked up.
Are you in immediate danger?
Yes.
Can you get to a safe place?
I'm in a closet.
Alright, stay there. If you don't want to talk, just tap once for 'yes' and twice for 'no.'
Are you in a closet in your bedroom?
Yes.
Is there anyone else in the house with you?
No, just me.
Are there any possible exits from the house?
The back door.
No weapons in the house, correct?
Correct.
I'm going to stay on the phone with you until officers are there. Is the back door locked?
Yes.
Are you still in the closet?
Yes.
Can you hear them in the room?
Yes, they're rummaging through things.
They ran out. I see the cops!
Is the police officer with you?
No, they are running towards the backyard!
The officers are in the area, stay on the phone with me.
They're running towards another house!
The officers have them on sight.
The guy in the red jumpsuit is still running.
Can you see where he's heading?
Towards the apartment complex.
Alright, officers are following him now. Are you okay?
I think so. It was so scary.
You did really well. We're going to make sure everything is clear now. Do you see any damage?
Yes, they broke a window.
If you feel safe, I can let you go now, officers are out there.
Okay, thank you.
You did a great job. You're welcome. Bye.
Bye.
